00041     // The following typedefs and the struct are
00042     // for "advanced" completers
00043 typedef function< void ( const vector< string > & ) >   Func;
00044 typedef pair< string, Func >                            Element;
00045 
00046 struct MyElement : public Element
00047 {
00048     operator string () const { return first; }
00049     MyElement( const string & Arg1, Func  Arg2 ) : Element( Arg1, Arg2 ) {}
00050 };
00051 
00052 typedef list< MyElement >     MyContainer;
00053 
00054 
00055     // A functor to look for a command in the 
00056     // container of completers
00057 class LookupFunctor
00058 {
00059     public:
00060             // Creates a functor and memorises tokens
00061         LookupFunctor( const vector< string > &  tokens ) :
00062             Tokens( tokens )
00063         {}
00064 
00065             // Compares the first token only
00066         bool operator()( const MyElement &  Element ) const
00067         {
00068             return strncmp( Tokens.begin()->c_str(),
00069                             (static_cast< string >( Element )).c_str(),
00070                             Tokens.begin()->size() ) == 0;
00071         }
00072 
00073     private:
00074         const vector< string > &  Tokens;
00075 };

00081     // The 'help' command processor
00082 class SHelpExecutor
00083 {
00084     public:
00085             // Memorises the list of completers
00086         SHelpExecutor( const MyContainer &  completers ) :
00087             Completers( completers )
00088         {}
00089 
00090             // Prints all the completers on the std out
00091         void operator() ( const vector< string > &  Unused )
00092         {
00093             cout << "List of the command variations:" << endl;
00094             for ( MyContainer::const_iterator  k( Completers.begin() );
00095                   k != Completers.end(); ++k )
00096             {
00097                 cout << static_cast< string >( *k ) << endl;
00098             }
00099         }
00100     private:
00101         const MyContainer &   Completers;
00102 };

00117     // The 'filesize' command executor
00118     // It prints the size of the given file in bytes
00119 void FileSize( const vector< string > &  Tokens );
00120 void FileSize( const vector< string > &  Tokens )
00121 {
00122     if ( Tokens.size() != 2 )
00123     {
00124         cout << "The filesize command supposes the file name" << endl;
00125         return;
00126     }
00127 
00128     struct stat     Stat;
00129     if ( stat( Tokens[1].c_str(), &Stat ) != 0 )
00130     {
00131         cout << "Cannot get info for the given '" 
00132              << Tokens[1] << "' file. Check the name." << endl;
00133         return;
00134     }
00135     
00136     cout << "File '" << Tokens[1] << "' size: " 
00137          << Stat.st_size << " bytes" << endl;
00138 }

00143 int  main( int  argc, char **  argv )
00144 { 
00145         // First parameter is a file name to save / load the
00146         // commands history. The second is a max number of stored commands
00147         // Both parameters could be ommited. In this case the history size
00148         // will be 64 and no save/restore operations will be performed.
00149     SReadline           Reader( "/tmp/.testhist", 32 );
00150 
00151         // Completers with functions to be called
00152     MyContainer         AdvancedCompleters;
00153 
00154         // Help executor functor
00155     SHelpExecutor       HelpExecutor( AdvancedCompleters );
00156 
00157 
00158         // The following is supported:
00159         // - "identifiers"
00160         // - special identifier %file - means to perform a file name completion
00161     AdvancedCompleters.push_back( MyElement( "help", 
00162                                              boost::bind1st( 
00163                                                  boost::mem_fun( &SHelpExecutor::operator() 
00164                                                                ), &HelpExecutor 
00165                                                            ) 
00166                                            ) 
00167                                 );
00168     AdvancedCompleters.push_back( MyElement( "exit", 0 ) );
00169     AdvancedCompleters.push_back( MyElement( "timeofday", TimeOfDay ) );
00170     AdvancedCompleters.push_back( MyElement( "filesize %file", FileSize ) );
00171 
00172 
00173         // Now register the completers.
00174         // Actually it is possible to re-register another set at any time
00175     Reader.RegisterCompletions( AdvancedCompleters );
00176         
00177     
00178         // true when we should exit
00179     bool                    EndOfInput( false );
00180         // List of the entered tokens
00181     vector< string >        Tokens;
00182         // Search iterator
00183     MyContainer::iterator   Found( AdvancedCompleters.end() );
00184 
00185 
00186     for ( ; ; )
00187     {
00188             // We get the list of tokens
00189         Reader.GetLine( "Please input your command> ", Tokens, EndOfInput );
00190         if ( EndOfInput )
00191         {
00192             cout << "End of the session. Exiting." << endl;
00193             break;
00194         }
00195 
00196         if ( !Tokens.empty() )
00197         {
00198             if ( *Tokens.begin() == "exit" )    break;
00199 
00200             Found = find_if( AdvancedCompleters.begin(), AdvancedCompleters.end(), 
00201                              LookupFunctor( Tokens ) );
00202 
00203                 // If found the first token in the list of completers -
00204                 // call the stored function
00205             if ( Found != AdvancedCompleters.end() )
00206             {
00207                 if ( Found->second != 0 ) Found->second( Tokens );
00208             }
00209             else
00210             {
00211                 cout << "Unknown command. Type 'help' for the list of acceptable commands" 
00212                      << endl;
00213             }
00214         }
00215         
00216         cout << "Press Ctrl+D for gracefull exit" << endl;
00217     }
00218         
00219     return 0;
00220 }
